title: Drone briefing (Office of the Governor - New Jersey)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any slideshows, presenter notes, or handouts produced for speakers at the 11 December 2024 briefing on drone sightings at the New Jersey State Police Operations Center;
- Any written meeting minutes or audiovisual records of that meeting.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents. For example, if any of the slides in the slideshow contain law enforcement sensitive data, please black out that data and provide the rest of the slideshow.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

The scope of this request includes the following legislators and all staff that report directly to the legislators:

Secretary of State Tre Hargett
Tennessee Coordinator of Elections Mark Goins
Tennessee State Election Commission Members: Donna Barrett, Murfreesboro; Judy Blackburn, Morristown; Jimmy Eldridge, Jackson; Mike McDonald, Portland; Secondra Meadows, Chattanooga; Bennie Smith, Memphis; and Kent Younce, LaFollette

The search for records should include sent and received emails and any other electronic records including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar records, text messages, and messages on messaging platforms, such as Slack, GChat or Google Hangouts, iMessage, WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram, Skype, Twitter direct messages, Facebook Messenger, or Parler. The search for email records should also include any email accounts used to conduct official business, including personal email addresses such as a "gmail" or "yahoo" account.

Please include any attachments to those records and other materials enclosed with those records at the time they were transmitted. For instance, for an email that is responsive to our request, please include all prior messages sent or received in that email chain, as well as any attachments to the email.

The search for records may be limited to records created, sent or received between January 1st, 2024 through to the date of your final response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, please notify me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Additionally, I would like to request a fee waiver. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by email attachment if available, or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Victoria Cadostin.

title: OSC case number: DI-12112024134 the Office of Special Counsel (OSC)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: All records, communications, and correspondence related to the following case number: DI-12112024134 Freedom of Information Act Request – OSC Complaints and Correspondence

Date: December 12, 2024

To, OSC FIOA officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I hereby request access to all records related to the following:

1. OSC Complaint Documentation:
All records, communications, and correspondence related to the following complaint numbers:
DI-12112024134
2. ADA Compliance:
All internal and external communications regarding ADA accommodation requests and compliance associated with my complaint.
Policies, guidelines, and internal procedures followed by OSC in addressing ADA accommodations.
3. Decision-Making Records:
All records, memoranda, meeting notes, and emails related to the review, processing, or decisions regarding complaint DI-12112024134.
4. Personnel Information:
Names, titles, and roles of all individuals involved in handling and reviewing complaint DI-12112024134, including ADA coordinators, investigators, and supervisory personnel.
5. Statutory Justifications for Actions:
Any statutory or procedural justifications for redactions, delays, or other actions related to this complaint.
Requested ADA Accommodations (Non-Negotiable):
MuckRock Platform Only:
All responses must be delivered exclusively through the MuckRock platform. Portal logins, phone calls, physical mail, or external links are not acceptable.
Accessible Formats:
Embed all response text directly into the email body for accessibility.
Provide PDF attachments formatted for screen-reader compatibility.
Simplified Summaries:
Summarize lengthy or technical records for ease of understanding.
Identification of Responsible Personnel:
Identify all FOIA officers, ADA coordinators, and supervisory personnel involved.
Statutory Justifications:
Provide detailed statutory justifications for all redactions or denials in compliance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b).
Expedited Processing:
This request is submitted under expedited processing due to its significant public interest and the critical impact on ADA compliance.

Fee Waiver Request:
I request a waiver of all fees associated with this request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), as the information sought is in the public interest and not for commercial use.

Escalation Notice:
Failure to comply with this FOIA request or provide legally required ADA accommodations will result in escalation to oversight bodies, including federal courts, advocacy organizations, and relevant oversight offices.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your acknowledgment and response within the statutory timeframe of 20 business days.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
DB.42.131.Inf. https://www.ctbraininjury.com/blog/tags/db-42-131-inf
https://x.com/ABIresources/status/1866212331279339765 https://www.youtube.com/@ABI.RESOURCES-CT-ABI-MFP-CARE/videos?view=0&sort=dd&shelf_id=2

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Tarence Mitchell 2013 Murder Case
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking all records related to the 2013 murder case of Ronald "Rondale" Taylor involving Tarence Mitchell. This includes police reports, witness statements, any available interrogation footage, 911 call recordings, body and dash camera footage, forensic reports, autopsy results, and court transcripts, as well as any other related documents or evidence collected during the investigation and trial.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ore Adebanjo

title: Performance Guarantees for Subdivision Construction in Acton

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Performance Guarantees for Subdivision Construction in Acton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

For each of the Subdivisions listed below, please provide:

(1)	A copy of the subdivision surety provided under G.L. c.41 §81U (performance guarantee, e.g. bond, restrictive covenant, etc.) and any amendments thereof;
(2)	Every written request to extend the completion date specified within the subdivision surety;
(3)	Every written request for partial release of the subdivision surety, and records of the granting of any such requests;
(4)	Every written request for final release of the subdivision surety, with all accompanying documentation, and records of receipt of such requests by (i) the Acton Planning Board and (ii) the Acton Town Clerk;
(5)	Any written certification by the Town of Acton that the principal has completed all obligations specified in the surety;
(6)	A record authorizing the final release of the subdivision security.


List of Subdivisions:

PB 13-05, “The Residences at Constitution Drive”
PB 14-03, “Roosevelt Drive”
PB 14-04, “Hayward Farm”
PB 15-07, “Jaime’s Way & Thomas Drive”
PB 16-10, “Mohegan Lane”
PB 16-15, “Summer Place”
PB 16-19, “Kellev’s Corner Southeast Lots”
PB 17-08, “Laurentide Circle”
PB 18-03, “180 Newtown Road PCRC”
PB 18-05, “110 Nagog Hill Road”
PB 19-04 “96 Newtown Road/Dylan Place”
PB 19-06, “Pond View Way”
PB 19-10, “Diplatzi Place”
PB 20-02, “The Preserve at Audubon Hill”
PB 21-02, “Amanda Lane”
PB 21-03, “Grassy Pond Way”
PB 21-07, “Hawk’s Crest Reserve”
PB 22-07, “Timber Way”

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

communications.subject: Your Town of Acton, MA public records request #24-260 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Town of Acton, MA ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-260 has been submitted successfully. Hello, The Town Clerk’s office is in receipt of your request and will provide you a reply as soon as possible, but in any event within the ten (10) business days required by statute.   This request will be forwarded to the appropriate Departments. If the responding Department(s) believe that the search and collection of requested documents will take more than two hours, that Department will provide you with an estimate of costs for the retrieval of the requested Public Records. That estimated fee will be based on a fee of $25.00 per hour for each hour (or part thereof) over two hours. We will require payment of the estimated fee prior to gathering the requested information. If a thumb/flash drive is needed due to the large amount of data, we will assess an additional $5.00 fee for that hardware.     You will be contacted if there are any questions or we need further information. Once the information has been gathered, it will be forwarded to you.   “The records access officer shall provide a written response under M.G.L. c. 66, § 10(b) to a request for public records no later than the tenth business day following the receipt of a request notwithstanding the applicability of any petition filed pursuant to 950 CMR 32.06(4)”.    Please contact this office if you have any questions.   Thank you. Acton Town Clerk As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Town of Acton, MA portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Town of Acton, MA through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Town of Acton, MA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Court Dataset Requested
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

RAW data queried out of your computer system on court data from January 2021 to the most recent date data is collected. In CSV, TXT, or XML format, a machine-readable spreadsheet (not XLSX format). This data must include location of arrest.

Master Incident Number, Case Number or Event Number so that the case can be matched with a 911 dispatch data 
Case Type 
Court type (district or superior) 
Filing date 
Hearing dates 
Verdicts/Judgements 
Sentencing Information 
Appeals 
Documents 
Filed 
Offense Codes 
Charges or claims 
Count of records excluding this record 
County Court Room/Location 
Trial Date 
Court Session 
Defendant Name 
Defendant Street Address Line 1 
Defendant Street Address Line 2 
Defendant City Address 
Defendant State Address Abbreviation 
Defendant Address Zip Code 
Defendant Address Extended Zip Code 
Date of Birth Race 
Sex 
Citation Number 
Person Identification Number 
Case Status (active; pending; disposed; unknown/invalid case status) 
Case History 
Fines and Fees 
Case Disposition 
Court Orders 
Sentencing Compliance

A data manager from another jurisdiction described the data this way:

"Cases Convicted in 2021-2024: all of the columns should be fairly self-explanatory. You can feel free to ignore any column related to “WCL,” which is an internal measurement.
Cases with Appeals: These are the cases which were appealed to the Court of Appeals and their corresponding case numbers.
Cases with Restitutions and Fees: Fees refer to non-restitution charges."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

bocar ba

communications.subject: Fwd: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Court Dataset Requested
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon

The Hamilton County Clerk of Courts received your request for
documents.	 We are unable to fulfill your request for documents at
this time. 

The release of Court records such as is requested here is governed by
the Ohio Rules of Superintendence. The volume of your request requires
the bulk transfer of information.  We do not maintain any current
compilation of the information you requested in the form you requested. 
 Ohio Rule of Superintendence 46 states that in creating a new
compilation for bulk distribution of information in court records, we
may consider if creating a new compilation is an appropriate use of its
available resources.   We do not have the necessary available resources
at this time to fulfill your request for bulk information.

title: Request for Sterling PD's 2023 - 2024 calls for service

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Request for Sterling PD's 2023 - 2024 calls for service
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A list of service calls responded to regarding homeless individuals between Sept 1, 2023 and Sept 17, 2024 and all relevant results of those calls including but not limited to 
 property crimes
violent crimes
arrests
citations
disorderly conduct
and violations of sex offender registration and protection orders.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Zeke Martin

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Current HS Principals, CPS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Holly Dacres, Principal
* Dan Kramer, Principal

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements/agreements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016590-121124
Texas Public Information Act Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to all sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Policies and communications re: art installation

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Policies and communications re: art installation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications between Brian Noland and any elected official between November 10 and December 9, 2024.

2. Any communications sent to or by the Office of Government Relations (including any of its staff members) and sent to or by any elected official concerning the FL3TCHER Exhibit. This request is limited to communications between November 10 and December 9, 2024.

3. Any contract, agreement, or policies concerning the persons or entities responsible for the FL3TCHER Exhibit. (This request should not be construed as seeking a search of records held by the persons or entities responsible for the FL3TCHER Exhibit, but instead limited to records held by the university administration.)

4. Any policies concerning  the use of (or the availability of) the Reece Museum space for art installations, exhibits, or events. This request is limited to policies in place or used since January 1, 2024.

5. Any contracts between the Reece Museum and any curator or artist since January 1, 2022.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Records Pertaining to Complaint #542283-VPS and Associated Actions (U.s. Department Of Justice)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act Request
Date: December 10, 2024
To: FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit
U.S. Department of Justice
Room 115, LOC Building
Washington, DC 20530-0001
Email: MRUFOIA.Requests@usdoj.gov

Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Complaint #542283-VPS and Associated Actions

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I hereby request access to all records, documentation, and communications related to the processing, review, decision-making, and actions taken in connection with complaint #542283-VPS, submitted on December 2, 2024. This request includes records addressing allegations of systemic constitutional violations, ADA non-compliance, whistleblower retaliation, and associated governance issues.

Scope of Request
Complaint Review and Processing:

All internal records, including memos, emails, meeting notes, decision logs, and evaluations, documenting the review and disposition of complaint #542283-VPS.
Any workflows or internal task assignments related to this complaint, including timelines and responsible personnel.
External and Interagency Communications:

Correspondence between DOJ and external entities, including the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), the Connecticut Attorney General’s Office, and other federal or state agencies concerning the subject matter of the complaint.
Interagency directives or advisories relating to oversight or collaboration on systemic issues identified in the complaint.
Policy, Procedure, and Action Records:

Documentation of DOJ protocols, policies, or operational guidelines used in assessing, addressing, or dismissing complaint #542283-VPS.
Records of enforcement actions, case follow-ups, or formal referrals stemming from the complaint.
Personnel Involvement:

Identification of all DOJ personnel involved in processing or overseeing this matter, including their roles, decision-making authority, and communication logs.
Legal and Procedural Basis:

Any legal analyses, internal opinions, or statutory references justifying the decision communicated to me in your letter dated December 2, 2024, indicating no further action would be taken.
Supporting documentation outlining the DOJ's compliance with whistleblower protection standards, ADA obligations, and constitutional governance in this decision.
ADA and Whistleblower Protections:

All DOJ records, policies, and communications addressing ADA accommodations or whistleblower protections as applied in this case.
Documentation of any DOJ awareness, training, or application of ADA-compliant processes related to this complaint.
Accommodations Previously Requested
The following accommodations, explicitly outlined in prior communications, remain unfulfilled:

Exclusive Use of MuckRock Platform

Requested: All communications must be routed exclusively through the MuckRock platform. No external portals, password-protected links, or alternate communication methods are acceptable.
Non-Compliance: Communications have directed me to use external portals and password-protected links, violating ADA guidelines and my explicit requests.
Accessible Document Formatting

Requested: All documents must be provided as screen-reader compatible PDFs, properly labeled and indexed for ease of navigation and accessibility.
Non-Compliance: Provided documents have not adhered to accessibility standards, preventing effective access to critical information.
Simplified Summaries for Complex Records

Requested: Simplified summaries must accompany all complex or technical records to enhance comprehension and ensure equitable participation.
Non-Compliance: No summaries have been provided, creating unnecessary barriers to understanding the records.
Identification of Responsible Personnel

Requested: Each communication must include the name, title, and role of the individual responsible for processing or responding to my requests.
Non-Compliance: Correspondence has consistently lacked this information, hindering accountability and effective follow-up.

Immediate Action Required

Request for Expedited Processing
Given the significant public interest in transparency regarding whistleblower retaliation, ADA compliance, and constitutional violations, expedited processing is requested under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). Immediate access to these records is essential to addressing ongoing harm and systemic governance issues.

Request for Fee Waiver
As this request is made in the public interest and not for commercial purposes, I request a fee waiver under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). Disclosure of these records will contribute substantially to public understanding of government operations and decision-making.

Deadline and Compliance Expectations
I anticipate your acknowledgment of this request within the statutory 20 business days and fulfillment of the request without undue delay. Any refusal to provide responsive records must be accompanied by a detailed justification citing specific statutory exemptions.

Failure to comply with FOIA obligations or provide the requested accommodations will necessitate escalation through administrative appeals, formal complaints to oversight bodies, and judicial remedies.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
DB.42.131.Inf.
ABI Resources https://www.ctbraininjury.com/blog/tags/db-42-131-inf https://x.com/ABIresources/status/1866212331279339765 https://www.youtube.com/@ABI.RESOURCES-CT-ABI-MFP-CARE/videos?view=0&sort=dd&shelf_id=2


CC:

U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
Connecticut Attorney General’s Office
Relevant Congressional Oversight Committees

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

White House Communications Agency video footage (WHTV content) filmed during Azerbaijani President Heydar Aliyev and President George W Bush's February 26th 2003 "photo op" press and photographer availability in the Oval Office.  This is a request to review all footage from that Oval Office meeting, including outtakes and rushes.

While there are photographs of the meeting online, I am unable to find any video. Here's an image from that day: https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/president-george-w-bush-meets-with-president-heydar-aliyev-news-photo/525613918

I respectfully ask that released video from this meeting be uploaded to the @GWBLibrary YouTube page, as has been done with other requests. Thank you, and I look forward to working with you in having this request fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: PLRA & EEOC 28 CFR § 39.170 for federal prisoners with disabilities (Equal Employment Opportunity Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: PLRA & EEOC 28 CFR § 39.170 for federal prisoners with disabilities (Equal Employment Opportunity Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or information relating to the implementation of requiring inmates to exhaust their remedies under both the Prison Litigation Reform Act and EEOC 28 C.F.R. § 39.170 before they can bring a claim under the Rehabilitation Act. 

Any records or information relating to the creation of the 28 CFR § 39.170 for federal inmates bringing conditions of confinement claims relating to disabilities. 

Any grievances or complaints by inmates regarding the double exhaustion requirement of the PLRA and EEOC in order to bring a Rehabilitation Act claim. 

Any meeting minutes, memorada, press releases, releases, MOUs, etc. that discuss inmates required exhaustion of remedies under the PLRA and 28 CFR § 39.170.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Richards

title: Special Confinement Unit at USP Terre Haute

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Special Confinement Unit at USP Terre Haute
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or information related to the housing of inmates sentenced to death to the Special Confinement Unit ("death row") at USP Terre Haute. This includes information and records pertaining to the creation of the Special Confinement Unit, why the Special Confinement Unit was created, when the Special Confinement Unit was created, the current procedures that govern the Special Confinement Unit, and any other administrative information pertaining to the Special Confinement Unit. 

Any records or information related to inmate grievances and/or complaints regarding the Special Confinement Unit for death sentenced inmates at USP Terre Haute.

Any communications or correspondences between, to, or from the Bureau of Prisons, Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Investigation, and the Central Intelligence agency pertaining to the Special Confinement Unit at USP Terre Haute.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Noel Ignatin File Request (Gary Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request disclosure of any records that were prepared, received, transmitted, collected and/or maintained by the FBI, the Chicago Police Department, the Philadelphia Police Department, and the Gary, IN Police Department relating to Noel Ignatin. and the Provisional Organizing Committeee Marxist-Leninist. 

I.	I also request disclosure of any files or records that were received, transmitted, collected, and/or maintained by the FBI on an organization titled Provisional Organizing Committee (Marxist-Leninist), or “P.O.C”/”POC”, with the time frame of 1958 to 1966. 
II.	I also request disclosure of any files or records that were received, transmitted, collected, and/or maintained by the FBI on an organization titled Sojourner Truth Organization, with the time frame of 1969 to 1985. 

I am Maks Bondarenko, an individual seeking information affiliated with the educational institution of the CUNY Graduate Center’s Biography and Memoir Master of Arts program, and this request is made for scholarly purposes, not for commercial use. As I am making a request for scholarly purposes, I am entitled to a waiver of fees on behalf of the CUNY Graduate Center and its Biography and Memoir Master of Arts program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maks Bondarenko

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request disclosure of any records that were prepared, received, transmitted, collected and/or maintained by the FBI, the Chicago Police Department, the Philadelphia Police Department, and the Gary, IN Police Department relating to Noel Ignatin. and the Provisional Organizing Committeee Marxist-Leninist.

II.	I also request disclosure of any files or records that were received, transmitted, collected, and/or maintained by the FBI on an organization titled Sojourner Truth Organization, with the time frame of 1969 to 1985.

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Prattville, Alabama parade denial
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications to or from Mayor Bill Gillespie concerning the Prattville Pride float in the 2024 Prattville Christmas parade. This includes any communications mentioning any of the following terms: pride, parade, lgbtq, lgbt, gay, homosexual, or drag.

2. Any records reflecting any cancellations (or requests to cancel) any float in the 2024 Prattville Christmas parade.

3. Any communications to or from, or incident reports by, the Prattville Police Department concerning the 2024 Prattville Christmas parade.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Request to FBI for all internal circulars of bulletins pertaining to entertainment industry products from 2020-2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to FBI for all internal circulars of bulletins pertaining to entertainment industry products from 2020-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all internal FBI circulars or bulletins, released during the last five years (2020-2024), listing or describing contacts with the entertainment industry or entertainment products supported by the FBI.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Thank you for submitting your foia.gov request
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting your FOIA request through FOIA.GOV to U.S. Marine Corps! 
You can track the status of your request, communicate with the agency regarding this request, or search previously released documents in our reading room using the SecureRelease portal. If you do not already have a SecureRelease portal account you can sign-up (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) here, just make sure to use 177342-23010751@requests.muckrock.com when you sign up to gain access to your request details. (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) 

Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us, please email SecureRelease Support and a member of our team will be happy to assist. (https://www.securerelease.us/) 
 

Take care, 

 
SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.
